actions.actionTitle: Protect Windows devices
actions.actionDescription: Deploy comprehensive protection for Windows devices using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, including real-time protection, behavioral monitoring, and cloud-delivered protection. This provides multi-layered defense against malware, ransomware, and advanced persistent threats.

actions.actionTitle: Block untrusted and unsigned processes that run from USB
actions.actionDescription: Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules to prevent execution of untrusted and unsigned executables from USB drives. This mitigates risks from malware spread through removable media and prevents unauthorized software installation.

actions.actionTitle: Schedule threat scans for Mac
actions.actionDescription: Configure scheduled antivirus scans for macOS devices using Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Regular scanning ensures thorough detection of dormant threats and maintains security hygiene on Mac endpoints.

actions.actionTitle: Use advanced protection against ransomware
actions.actionDescription: Enable controlled folder access and other anti-ransomware features in Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. This protects important folders from unauthorized changes and blocks ransomware from encrypting files in protected locations.

actions.actionTitle: Review malware and non-malware reports
actions.actionDescription: Regularly analyze threat detection reports from Microsoft 365 Defender to understand malware trends and false positive patterns. This helps optimize security policies and improve threat response strategies.

actions.actionTitle: Enable controlled folder access
actions.actionDescription: Activate controlled folder access in Windows Defender to protect valuable data from malicious apps and ransomware. This feature monitors apps attempting to make changes to files in protected folders and blocks unauthorized modifications.

actions.actionTitle: Enforce immediate temporary password change
actions.actionDescription: Configure Azure AD to require immediate password changes for temporary or first-time passwords. This ensures users create their own secure passwords and prevents unauthorized access through known temporary credentials.

actions.actionTitle: Use the system clock to generate time stamps for audit records
actions.actionDescription: Ensure all systems synchronize with authoritative time sources using NTP to maintain accurate timestamps in audit logs. This is critical for forensic analysis, correlation of security events, and compliance requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Require mobile devices to use a password
actions.actionDescription: Enforce password or PIN requirements on all mobile devices through Intune compliance policies. This basic security control prevents unauthorized access to corporate data on mobile devices and ensures minimum authentication standards.

actions.actionTitle: Create and publish sensitivity label policies for content in relevant sites and applications
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft Information Protection label policies to SharePoint, OneDrive, and Teams to ensure consistent data classification. These policies automatically apply labels based on content and enforce protection settings across collaboration platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Investigate insider risk management alerts
actions.actionDescription: Review and investigate alerts from Microsoft 365 Insider Risk Management to identify potential data theft, leaks, or policy violations by internal users. This includes analyzing user activity patterns and taking appropriate remediation actions.

actions.actionTitle: Create a Windows 10 app protection policy
actions.actionDescription: Configure Windows Information Protection (WIP) policies through Intune to protect corporate data in Windows 10 apps. This prevents accidental data leaks by controlling how users can copy, save, and share business information.

actions.actionTitle: Enable ability to remotely wipe data from mobile devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure selective wipe capabilities in Microsoft Intune to remove corporate data from lost or stolen devices while preserving personal information. This ensures business data protection without completely wiping personal devices in BYOD scenarios.

actions.actionTitle: Block Adobe Reader from creating child processes
actions.actionDescription: Configure Attack Surface Reduction rules to prevent Adobe Reader from spawning child processes. This blocks a common exploitation technique where PDF malware attempts to launch malicious processes through Adobe Reader.

actions.actionTitle: Protect important folders with controlled folder access
actions.actionDescription: Configure controlled folder access to protect Documents, Pictures, Videos, and Desktop folders by default from ransomware and untrusted applications. Additional custom folders containing critical business data can be added for protection.

actions.actionTitle: Set account lockout threshold to 5 or lower in macOS devices
actions.actionDescription: Configure macOS device policies through Intune to lock user accounts after 5 or fewer failed login attempts. This protects against brute force password attacks while balancing security with user experience.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy for Android devices
actions.actionDescription: Establish device compliance requirements for Android devices including minimum OS version, encryption, and threat protection. Non-compliant devices can be blocked from accessing corporate resources until they meet security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Block non-compliant devices and report policy violations
actions.actionDescription: Configure Conditional Access policies to block non-compliant devices from accessing corporate resources and generate reports on compliance violations. This enforces security standards and provides visibility into device compliance status.

actions.actionTitle: Keep antivirus definitions for macOS devices up to date
actions.actionDescription: Configure automatic definition updates for Microsoft Defender on macOS devices to ensure protection against the latest threats. This includes setting update frequency and managing update channels for timely protection.

actions.actionTitle: Investigate compromised mailboxes
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft 365 security tools to detect and investigate signs of mailbox compromise including unusual login patterns, mail forwarding rules, and mass deletions. This helps identify breached accounts and assess the scope of potential data exposure.
